title: Yorktown Battlefield Part of Colonial National Historical Park: Traveling Trunks
body: Ã— Rate the Lesson Plan             Traveling Trunk THE FORTUNES OF WAR TRAVELING TRUNK-YORKTOWN BATTLEFIELD   Yorktown Battlefield             Overall Rating  Add your review    Traveling trunk offers your students interactive, hands-on activities for studying the American Revolutionary War and the 1781 Siege of Yorktown. The trunk contains a Fortunes of War Resource Manual on the Revolutionary War;classroom activities and worksheets;reproduction military uniforms and accessories;period flags;toys and games, a copy of the surrender document form the 1781 Yorktown siege;and reproduction newspapers from 1776. Borrowing Instructions Borrowing the traveling trunk is free. Call the Program Support Specialist at 757-898-2411 to make arrangements to pick up the trunk from the National Park Service Visitor Center at Yorktown. It can be picked up any day of the week. Borrow period is two weeks.  Details  Subject: Revolutionary War National/State Standards:  Primary emphasis is placed on Virginia History and Social Science Standards of Learning: Virginia Studies, Colonization and Conflict: 1607 through the American Revolution, VS.5; and Revolution and the New National: 1770s to the Early 1800s, USI.6. type: Traveling Trunk              Lesson Plans  Revolutionary War Timeline   Lifestyle: Revolutionary War Era Clothing   Personal Effects of a Revolutionary War Soldier    Field Trips  War Comes to Morristown Field Trip   Holiday Treasures On-Site Education Program   My New Home On-Site Education Program    Topics  A Soldier's Notes From Michigan's Big Battle   John Smith's Masterpiece and Copyright Nightmare   The French and Indian War 1754-1763: Unit 3 - How Did the Conflict Begin?
